content.text: A sabbatical is a lengthy, intentional break from one's career. Organizations are also offering sabbatical leave as a means to provide flexibility to their female employees

content.heading: Examples of Sabbatical Leave Policies of Organizations

content.text: Off-track Policy: If a female employee wants to go on a sabbatical due to personal reasons, she is granted a leave of up to 2 years after the management committeeâ€™s approval. Upon her return, the organization accommodates her either in the same department, or elsewhere, as per the availability of positions at that time.
Female employees can take a sabbatical for a period of 6 months to 2 years, based on "family/personal needs."
